content=A fairy tale Georgian castle built between 1810 and 1824 from designs by Sir Robert Smirke.It sits within a 5,000 acre estate and is the family home for the Hervey-Bathursts who are the direct descendents of Earl Somers, the original owner. The castle sits in estate grounds of around 5000 acres and there are numerous walks as well as a deer park and an off-road driving circuit.
, which was built in 1852 to a design by the architect Sir George Gilbert Scott.
takes place in the gounds of Eastnor Castle in August.

There is a campsite for both tents and touring caravans at the Castle.
